meanings.definition: Treat or regard (someone) with contempt or disrespect.
meanings.sent1: She degrades her classmates by making fun of them.
meanings.sent2: Bullying someone only degrades their self-esteem.
meanings.sent3: The mean girl degrades others to feel better about herself.
meanings.sent4: His constant insults slowly degrade the morale of the team.
meanings.sent5: Using hurtful words to degrade others is never acceptable.

meanings.sent1: Constant wear and tear can degrade the quality of the furniture.
meanings.sent2: Neglecting maintenance can degrade the value of a property.
meanings.sent3: Leaving the painting in the sun might degrade its colors.
meanings.sent4: The economic crisis can degrade the value of the currency rapidly.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring customer feedback can degrade the reputation of a business.

meanings.sent1: Over time, metal can degrade and rust.
meanings.sent2: Exposure to harsh chemicals can degrade the plastic over time.
meanings.sent3: Leaving food out for too long can degrade its quality.
meanings.sent4: The old building started to degrade due to lack of maintenance.
meanings.sent5: The fabric of the shirt began to degrade after multiple washes.
